text: Richard Charles Blum (July 31, 1935 - February 27, 2022) was an American investor. He was the husband of United States Senator Dianne Feinstein. He was the chairman and president of Blum Capital, an equity investment management firm. Blum was on the boards of directors of many companies. He worked for CB Richard Ellis, until May 2009. He was the chairman of that board. He was a regent of the University of California from 2002 until his death. Blum died on February 27, 2022 in San Francisco, California from lung cancer, aged 86. ==References== Category:1935 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Deaths from lung cancer Category:Businesspeople from San Francisco
title: Richard C. Blum
